Wed., Sept. 27: 100th death row exoneree Ray Krone visits Eastern Kentucky.
  

Witness to Innocence Tour

100th death row exoneree Ray Krone visits Eastern Kentucky.
RSVP
   Share this:                  

If you forward, the links will open to a page with your personal information.

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

The 100th person exonerated from death row in the United States is making two stops in your area to share his story.

Join us on Wednesday, September 27 at SCTC Laurel Campus North and University of the Cumberlands to meet Ray Krone and learn how you can get involved in the movement to end capital punishment in the Commonwealth.

SCTC Laurel Campus North
Wednesday, Sept. 27, 11 a.m. - 1 p.m.
Health Science Building - Room 113
100 University Drive
London, Kentucky 40741
RSVP

University of the Cumberlands
Wednesday, Sept. 27, 6:30 - 7:30 p.m.
Grace Crum Rollins Art Center
6178 College St.
Williamsburg, KY 40769
RSVP

Ray co-founded Witness to Innocence with Sister Helen Prejean in 2003. Before his exoneration in 2002, Ray spent more than 10 years in Arizona prisons – including nearly three years on death row for a murder he did not commit. With the help of DNA testing, Ray became the 100th person exonerated from death row since the reinstatement of capital punishment in the United States in 1976.

The event is free and open to the public. Light refreshments will be served. Questions? Email us at info@aclu-ky.org.

We hope to see you there!

Sincerely,

Michael Aldridge
Executive Director
ACLU of Kentucky
